Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Good, just not worth the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Very light and comfortable. Crisp clean sound
Cons: Seems easy to break. Lack of bass. No hard case
I like these headphones because they are so light, I almost forget im wearing them. Also they don’t pinch when I wear my eyeglasses like some other headphones. The problem is that they just feel very cheap to me. I’m afraid that their going to break when I put them in my bag. For the amount of money that these cost, they should really include a nice hard case.
The sound quality is very good. The highs and mids are crisp, sharp, and clear. My only complaint is the lack of bass. They have some when listening to songs with a lot of bass but not much any other time.
Overall, they sound good… Just not worth $150

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Good sound for a good price
Item.Review:
Pros: Great comfort and sound
Cons: Needs kid glove care/handling
The AE2 Audio Headphones are very comfortable, great sounding, and decently priced. Replaced my Bose AE phones I bought 3 years ago with these; fabric on the ear cushions were coming apart. The ear cup cushions on these feel a lot more sturdy. The light weight of these, however, gives a flimsy feel on the overall construction; made of mostly plastic. Clean mids and highs, and a very bold bass, makes for a very well balanced sounding headphone.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight, comfortable, great quality
Cons: Could come with a better carrying case
I have had the Bose in ear headphones for the last 6 years. When my first pair broke Bose sent me a replacement pair for half price (my cat had chewed through the wires). I was looking for some over the ear headphones and chose the Bose AE2's. I am extremely pleased with their comfort and performance. The sound quality is very crisp and clear. The bass is pretty good. I would highly recommend this product to others. I got them on sale so went for the black tie protection which at 19.99 you cant beat. (Two years replacement for any reason).

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: -Comfortable, even for 8 to 10 hour workdays, no uncomfortable pressure. I wear them 40 hours+ a week. This was the reason for my purchase by far - all of my other headphones would start to hurt in some way by midday.
-Lightweight, the most lightweight of over the ear headphones I tried on so far.
-Wonderfully equalized for a listener of a variety of music- I listen to blues, hard rock, classical, and even audiobooks - all a great experience.
-Bass, treble, and highs do not overpower each other. Your music will sound completely new then you have ever heard before.
-$150 less then their noise cancelling brother and without the need for a battery. They are also slightly isolated by themselves.
-Everyone is going to tell you those are some nice hea ... dphones. Could be a con, the BOSE brand has always spoken quality
Cons: -If you want these for studio use, these are not for you, try the Sennheisers. These are already tuned and not for that.
-If *ALL* you listen to is rap, techno, or heavily bass driven music, then these are not for you, try the beats or another comparable brand. These are slightly shallow on the bass side (compared to similarly priced models) due to a closed air design to keep the music private.
-The wire is a little to long for personal use, and a little piggly-wiggly by getting twisty all the time
- Just go to your nearest electronics store and try out all of the headphones by bringing your own music. Do not try to base your decision off reviews alone. I bought these while at the store to buy another brand - their comfort changed my mind.
- I have found in the past that heavy bass over long periods of time usually causes my ears uncomfortable pressure. Considering this, the Bose may actually be better for the longer periods of time for a smoother bass. Just something to consider expand » « collapse

ONly have had for a few weeks. The better the source of the music the better they perform. Light weight. Sound good, haven't heard anything better for the price.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything from noise cancellation to quality to comfort!
Cons: Nothing (unless you love to crank your bass)
The other night I randomly decided to run up to Best Buy at 8:30 pm to listen to some headphones since I was getting excited about buying a new pair after researching about headphones at home. I have to admit I was listening to all the details to all the headphones there and I almost had one picked out when my brother pointed out these that why hadn't tried out yet. So I put on the AE2's and fell in love! Immediately after loving the comfort and quality for the price I took them to check out. Then while I was driving home I got concerned that maybe I rushed things too much with my decision making. But after using them even more at home I can't help but say I've f ... allen even more in love.
I'm a songwriter and do my own original recordings at home. I have 2 nice mics I love to use for my recordings (MXL Genesis and the Blue Bluebird). I always wanted to have a nice pair of headphones for my studio so I could take advantage to the full quality of the music I record and listen to. Well I found some! These are perfect for mixing too and Im so impressed with the noise cancellation that I wasn't even expecting them to have when I bought them.
Just so you all know. These headphones don't have a super powerful bass and if you try to turn it up too much it gets a little muddy. But as long as you keep the lows not too high on the EQ they sound great. I'm a huge supporter of less bass. I think that headphones that have powerful bass capabilities take away from the purpose of the music which is mainly in the mids and highs. So I guess it depends on who you are, but I like the way the bass is in these headphones. Just how I like it!
The other things I love about these headphones is if you have the music at a lower volume there is almost no noise leakage! Which is perfect for me (being a solo artist recording all my own tracks) to record over top of my tracks because my microphones won't pick up the noise from the headphones when I record vocals. Also the noise cancellation is p ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: sound and comfortable
Cons: needs more bass and midrange
First, I suggest you try on the various headphones in the store. You want headphones that are comfortable to wear after 30 minutes. You will not know this by trying on headphones for a few minutes. Only you can decide what is comfortable for you. Uncomfortable headphones can make your ears and/or head hurt and your ears feel hot over a period of time.
Everyone hears sounds differently and have various expectations. For some people, a $10 headphone is good enough. You have to decide the quality that will satisfy you within your budget.
I tested all the over-the-ear and on-the-ear headphones in the BestBuy store that were available. It is difficult to test the headphones in the store because they are a ... ll hooked up to different sources and music. Some not hooked up to anything or no access to the plug. So, no sound test in the store can be accurate. But the ones I liked the best under $200 was the Bose AE2 and OE, SkullCandy Aviator, and the Sony Extended Bass. The BEATS headphones were well above my budget limit. The Pioneer HDJ-1000 was recommended by a BestBuy employee. Of these, the Sony was by far the least expensive but the most uncomfortable for me after 10 minutes of wear. They were not attached to any source, so I connected it to my Android phone. As the name says, there is a lot of bass.
The SkullCandy had a good sound and were comfortable, but lacked bass. Unfortunately, I have no idea if the lack of bass is from a poor source/settings. A comparative test is the only way to know. BestBuy allows you to return the product within 30 days, Silver Rewards gives you 45 days. But, if you buy now you have until Jan 31, 2012 to make a Holiday return.
The Bose AE2 was very comfortable and light weight. They are over the ears like the SkullCandy with better sound. But, in the store it was difficult to hear the bass. The BOSE OE was similar in sound to the AE2 except it was on the ear. The AE2 blocks out more of the ambient noise in the room than the OE. The OE was ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality, Price, Comfort
Cons: Nothing.
I'm sitting here using the Bose AE2 headphones with my HP Laptop (which has Beats installed). Let me make this clear. They sound GREAT. Anyone who has a problem with the sound quality of these headphones has unrealistic expectations. I am a huge tech / audio / video guy and am very critical of the things I purchase. I have to say that there is nothing to be critical of here. Yes they have a very long chord. So what. I'd rather have it and not need it than need it and not have it! They are extremely comfortable. More comfortable than any other pair I tried out at the local Best Buy store. Here is the most important part... The sound quality is outstanding. I listen to many different types of music and have never thought to mys ... elf, I wish these had more bass. They have plenty. As a matter of fact, they have just the right amount of bass. Mids and highs are crisp and blend well. I will agree with a couple of the reviews on here about the case. I would like a hard case, but you pay for what you get.
I am happy with the purchase. I didn't have to spend $300 and I got a great pair of headphones. I would have no problem recommending these to anyone.
Good Luck! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Light, comfortable, no batteries needed
Cons: no case included, only a cheap bag
I have the QC15's and thought those were the most comfortable headphones ever, until I tried these. These are very similar in style, but are more comfortable because they are much lighter than the QC15's, and better yet - they don't need batteries. I compared the two for sound quality, and the QC15's sound noticably better, however, the AE2's sound very good for half the price. So if you're looking for comfort this is the way to go! I think these replace the old triport headphones, I found the triports very uncomfortable so this is a huge improvement! Also improved is the removable/replacable cord. I just wish these would come with a nice carrying case like the QC15's instead of a cheap bag ... . (these don't quite fit in the QC15's case even though they are a very similar design). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, Accurate and Sophisticated Sound you would expect from Bose
Cons: price
Well first of all, i can not believe some of the negative reviews i have read about this product, although i can agree that the bass is lacking a bit and could use a 10% boost, the overall quality of the sound is extremely submersing and inviting. I found that if you mess with the EQ on itunes and convert the songs to a higher bit rate, the sound is much crisper and provides a better listening experience. These are also sleek looking headphones and are beyond comfortable, and do not fatigue your ears at all. I think the most important thing you can do after buying them is to give them about 20-30 hours of break-in time before you judge how good they are. It really makes a difference, and i ... could really notice how good they sounded 2 weeks later. I think that if you listen to more bass driven music such as metal or rap, you will be disappointed because these can not really keep up. But for mello rock, blues and acoustic is where these stand out in the crowd and sound superb. Overall a great buy and i am happy about my purchase, don't listen to the people who say these suck, because it is simply not true! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Good clarity, but lacks a punch
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort and clarity
Cons: Bass response
Very comfortable and clear highs, but lacks the punch of bass that you like in a $150 pair of headphones. For extra bass (needed in the gym) I use Sony - Extra Bass Over-the-Ear Headphones (Model MDR-XB500). Only reason I bought the AE2s is because the Sonys are too bulky and they lack clarity. Different strokes for different folks.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review: These headphones are very comfortable and have outstanding sound. Equally as good for classical and pop. No deadness, no excessive bass or inappropriate midrange or treble peaks like a lot of other headphones suffer from. The cable is replaceable and they even have an accessory cable that includes a microphone for use with an iPhone. The AE2's are everything I expected from Bose,and then some!

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Love'em. Full coverage without the bulk.
Item.Review:
Pros: Full sound, lightweight, durable, worth the money
Cons: Bass has it's limited (but you have to push them)
I've had these headphones for a couple of years now and I'm still loving them. They look and work just as they did when I bought them. For the money I think this is a great at-home/computer headset. You get the benefits of full around-the-ear coverage but the headset doesnt feel heavy or bulky (though I wouldn't say they're fit for use with outdoor activities). And while they aren't "noise-cancelling", the snug fit makes them pretty good for air travel. They're great for watching movies as well. They are very soft, light and comfortable so you won't get "tired" of having them on.
Sound reproduction is very clean and they have a reasonable threshold before the ... bass begins to distort. I have to really crank them up to get distortion but I don't normally listen at that volume level so it's not an issue for me.
There are cheaper headphones that offer similar sound quality but, for th emoney, I don't think there are many that match the Bose AE2's combination of sound and comfort. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:

I purchased these HeadPhones on Feb 25, 2012 for $149. at the Brentwood, CA store and tested every single set they had in the store and finally settle on these because of the clear, crisp sound. The experience you come to expect from BOSE is captured in these. You expect nothing less from this company. Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review: I received these headphones as a gift from my wife to use while traveling and sometimes at home when working on the computer. Worth mentioning, these are not noise cancelling nor are they designed to be. With that said, on the plane, you can still hear muffled voices as well as the loudspeaker the flight attendants use. However, the muffled sound is a huge improvement over the alternative. Additionally, I like the idea of not having to worry about a battery especially when traveling; like you would have to with the noise cancelling ones. My one gripe, the makers from Bose should at least supply a case with these. You pay a decent chunk of change for these nice headphones but all they give you is a bag to carry them in. I have looked for a hard case to put these in and eventually found a ha ... rd portable DVD player case that has a pouch for DVDs and extra room for a paperback book while still fitting my headphones. Please Bose, make a case for these for crying out loud. I dont want to pay an extra $150 for a hard case and battery operated headphones! Also, there is not much bass with these headphones but I do not really care about the bass so this is not a downside for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight, solid sound, not overbearing on the head
Cons: The high price
I was hesitant on purchasing these Bose AE2 headphones at first, since the price was a bit out of my league. But once I tried them on, I knew I had to get them. The overall sound was rich, and regardless of what genre of music I listened too, it covered all the ranges well. I finally kicked in a gift card and a reward zone coupon to justify the price. You will just have to take the time to listen to them, for each person has a taste, just like what kind of flat screen hits your desire for viewing. You will know which headset will blow your brains out with bass, or sit in comfort listening to pure music, these AE2's will not disappoint!

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort.
Cons: Everything besides comfort.
I'm really baffled by the positive reviews for these. The demo headphones weren't working in store but I was impressed by the comfort and figured Bose headphones must have nice sound right? Wrong. It was tinny, shrill, and had absolutely no bass. It seems like all detail and focus was on the highs with the lows completely ignored. They're useless for any rock that isn't elevator music and forget about other genres like rap or techno. I know some people say headphones need to be burned in, but these were so far away from the kind of sound I wanted that I simply returned them the next day. Most of what I listen to is rock ranging from classics to pop-punk and other semi alternative rock. For the price, there are much better headp ... hones out there - in Best Buy alone the Klipsch Image One and Skullcandy Aviators have far superior sound for similar price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable as hell
Cons: Overall quality for the price
After shelling out nearly 150 bucks for these headphones I am compelled to lie to myself and give them a good review, however for the sake of those looking to buy a magnificent pair of headphones - I'll throw in my two cents:
Sound quality: 4/5 stars These headphones are nice - very solid sound quality - but not spectacular. Bass is okay - even good. Higher notes are superb. Well rounded sound quality.
Comfort: 5/5 stars The most noteworthy feature of the Bose AE2s is comfort, these are *extremely* comfortable headphones.
Durability: 2/5 stars As far as the headphones themselves, the durability is good, so perhaps these deserve a 3/5. But after about 2 or 3 months of nightly u ... se, the cord (or the jack on the headphones) has developed a short - I really need to bring these in and get them serviced, but I've been putting it off because if I'm sitting still, the short doesn't bother me.
Overall value for the price: 2/5 stars After experiencing these headphones more personally out of the store, if I had the chance to go back and purchase them again, I wouldn't. For ~$140 these headphones are absolutely not worth the money. I'd say as far as the quality I've witnessed so far goes, they're worth $75 tops.
A solid product, don't get me wrong. But simply not worth the price.
Regards. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, comfortable.
These headphones are great. The sound quality is amazing. When i first but them on, I was amazed by the bass on these headphones. I have tried some other types of headphones like these, and wasn't really impressed with the bass. They completely cover your ear, blocking a lot of the outside noise. The padding is very comfortable. I've worn them for a couple hours at a time, and they don't start making my ears sore. I haven't really had them long enough to test durability, but they look like they are build solidly. Only down side is the price. They are a little more expensive than others in the same category, but the sound is worth the price.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, Sound Quality, Style
Cons: Case
These headphones are well worth the purchase. I was skeptical at first, buying my first pair of headphones that were over 100 dollars, and I have loved them ever since. They sound great for all music. If you are interested in the Beats, but don't wanna spend all that money, then these are your winner. I honestly like these better than the Beats, only because my music selection is not Hip-Hop/Rap. So I was not totally interested in having my eardrums beat to death with mini sub woofers. But I do listen to dubstep, and the bass sounds just fine to me, they still pound pretty hard! Just change your EQ. But for all other music, that is not overpowered by bass, sounds superb! I can turn these all the way up without loosing sound quali ... ty. Best quality sound I've ever heard. And all of the reviews on the comfort are true. After a while these headphones aren't even noticeable on your head. And in my own opinion, they look pretty sleek and sexy! And people that complain that they don't cancel out all of the sound, that is because these aren't noise cancelling, there are other headphones specifically made for that, these are just for listening to music! The long cord isn't a bother for me, only because I am always listening to them at my drafting table and I'm always moving around, and do not have to worry about my cord being too short. But i could see where it could bug some people. I guess the only thing I wish they would have changed is the case, its just cloth and I feel these babies should be in a steel safe haha. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:

So I've been on the hunt for a nice pair of headphones. I brought a few sets home including the beats by dre solo(199.99) and studios(299.99). The solo's sounded decent but after a few hours of use they started hurting my ear lobe, the studios were much more comfortable with lots of bass but not very clear. I noticed the studios made this annoying scratching noise and popping. So I went and bought the Bose qc15 (299.99) they didn't have as much bass as the studios but much more clear. The noise canceling technology on the bose qc15 are nice but I felt very congested with them on, after a few hours they gave me a headache. So today I returned them and got myself these Bose Ae2 and honestly they are exactly what I was looking f ... or. The price was right at (134.99 +19.99) warranty "which is worth it". These are exactly like the Bose qc15 but without the annoying noise canceling. Sound quality is pretty good for this price range. If you want massive bass, hold a boom box to your head but if you want some quality headphones go into best buy and try the demo. One more thing don't use these to workout unless you want a collection of sweat around your ears... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort, Sound Quality
These headphones are the best ones on display in the Best Buy store I work in. I've actually sold quite a few of them. The sound quality is amazing, I've heard nuances to certain songs that I could never hear before on my Koss DJ headphones. The opening of "Time of My Life" from Dirty Dancing sounds like a completely new song with these headphones. The bass isn't overpowering, but honestly, this is a good thing. Skullcandy Aviators and all the Beats by Dre models that I've sold have great sound too, but to me, the bass is overpowering, and the music sounds like it is coming from an amplified speaker whereas the Bose AE2s produce a sound that mirrors live music. Also, they are light and comfortable. A lot of people think lightweight headphones are cheaply ... built. Although they are plastic, they are infact very durable. Heavier sets that dont have correctly padded headbands can really annoy the very top of your head. Light is better, and if you are worried about breaking them, just purchase a protection plan through the store. You can exchange them as many times as needed in the two year period. And if you are thinking about upgrading to the noisecancelling QC15s, only get them if you plan on traveling by plane a lot. Noise cancellation still has a long way to go in my opinion. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver

I did a lot of research on different brands of headphones and went to several stores to listen to what was available in the area. I was replacing a set of wireless headphones which had just worn out. I was trying to limit myself to $100.00 maximum price. By the time I got to Best Buy I had narrowed it down to either Senheiser or Sony. The particular Best Buy store that I was at had no Sonys connected to demo and I was disappointed in the bass response of the Senheisers that I auditioned. I decided to audition some more expensive headphones to see the difference. Of course the Dr. Dres sounded fantastic, but there was no way I was going to spend $300.00 on headphones. I tried the Bose AE2s even though I know all ... Bose products seem to have become a joke to audiophiles. I was very surprised. They were not only extremely comfortable, but sounded great! As I continued to audition headphones, I kept coming back to the Bose AE2s. I finally took the plunge and can't be more happy. Two weeks later I am still amazed at the comfort and sound of the AE2s. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Okay, these cans are designed very well, from an ergonomic point of view. The reason I purchased these is because my other headphones (whose brand shall remain nameless) really start to hurt the outer areas of my ear after a few hours of use. These solved that problem, they're very comfortable.
Cons: My biggest complaint about these so far is shallow bass. While songs like Renegade, by Styx sound great; songs recorded without a lot bass, namely hard rock and heavy metal, sound kind of shallow and manufactured. This is due to the closed design of the drivers in the AE2's. It really limits the air the drivers can push, but makes music a little more private. With an open driver design, everyone in the room can hear your music.
I'm hoping after the drivers wear in a little ... better, the bass sound will improve. I've owned one other pair of headphones with a closed design, that couldn't push as much air. The bass drastically improved after about a month of use.
Another complaint is the chord connecting to the hardware. It keeps twisting and tangling on it's own. It curls up like a pig's tail, and looks really disorganized, and ratty for a mid to high end product.
All in all, these are great headphones, and will really be great for gaming. I live in a condo; so, playing Crysis with my Cerwin-Vega's kickin isn't gonna happen; at least if my neighbors have any say.
These are more than acceptable for gaming, and are comfy enough to wear throughout even the longest of gaming sessions. expand » « collapse

Overall great entry level bose headphones, but still if youre considering a bose product the qc15's are the best headphone produced by bose, but if they are a little too exspensive or you dont want to spend that much on headphones these are the way to go. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Clear sound and comfortable with glasses
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, comfort, detachable cord
Cons: Long cord, lower audio sensitivity (not as loud as other headphones)
I picked these headphones up about a month ago and they've been a very good buy. They sound great. In many songs I am hearing things that I have not heard before. I've wanted to listen to my entire collection of music again.
With these headphones I've been able to appreciate the sound quality of a lot of music. This being said, however, I feel like I've also noticed just how bad modern recordings are. With normalizing, and low quality engineering, the poor quality of those songs are more evident with these headphones. Especially low quality MP3's. They simply do not sound that good. It's like wearing a pair of glasses after being blind for so long. ... r> Many people complain about the bass response on these headphones. Keep in mind that these headphones aim at replicating the audio as true as possible, other headphones tend to emphasize the bass notes because it's become popular. That being said, these headphones can hit very low notes. I've been impressed several times that I could head bass this low on a pair of headphones.
I've owned sennheiser brand headphones for sometime and now I'm a big fan of Bose with this purchase. I also wear glasses and appreciate that I can wear these headphones with comfort for many hours. I use them daily for about 5-7 hours and they not hurt my ears. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: good quality headphones for the music lover
Item.Review:
Pros: sound range, quality, comfortable
Cons: price
I've always been a fan of Bose - I loved their surround stereo speakers, and I had a pair of IE2 headphones (the sound went out in one ear after a year, I've never been so depressed). I wanted a pair of over the ear headphones since I've been through so many earbuds. I first got the Skullcandy Skullcrushers for the subwoofer, but found they were muddy and inconsistent. I returned them for these.
The sound range is amazing but the lows (bass) are a bit weak. I slightly tweaked my equalizer settings, and now they sound absolutely amazing. They are not noise cancelling, but I like to hear a bit of what's going on around me anyway, AND you become immersed in the music, so I don't mind. Also, they are SO comfortable. I hav ... e an industrial piercing which tends to hurt when it's pressed for too long, but it doesn't hurt when I wear these for an extended period of time.
I listen to music every day, almost everywhere I go. These are fantastic headphones and I'm looking forward to continuing to use the Bose family for my sound needs. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: I really wanted to love these.....
Item.Review:
Pros: Very light, Very Comfortable, Noise reduction is good
Cons: No value for the price, Sound quality lacks to others in the same price range
But I just cant especially after buying and trying the Klipsch Image One headphones. I bought these because of the Bose name and after trying others I think that Bose is counting on just that. I read reviews for the Klipsch headphones and thankfully decided to try those at the same time as these and am taking the Bose back.
The only advantage the Bose have is that they are a bit more comfortable but thats it. They came with a faux leather carrying pouch and came in that god awful need a chainsaw to open plastic packaging inside the box. Just looking inside the headphones I was not impressed they just seemed very cheaply made an ... d very flimsy.
On the other hand I was immediately impressed when opening the Klipsch. There was no plastic packaging and the headphones came in a nice durable hard shell case along with gold plated adapters for 1/4 and airline adapter with room for other stuff also. The other thing the Klipsch had is the inline volume and play controls the Bose came with none of this.
The sound quality between the two is like night and day. To get the Bose anywhere near the powerful sound of the Klipsch I had to turn up the volume a 1/4 higher and still just wasnt as good. With both of these at the same price I am very dissapointed in the Bose and would look elsewhere for the money. I lucked out with the Klipsch and got the only ones left anywhere in my area without having to order them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.ReviewTitle: this is what they sound like?...really?
Item.Review: unfortunately they don't sound that great. some might be happy with their performance, but after walking around the store today, plugging different headphones into my ipod, i was less than impressed. I was leaning towards the scull candy aviators because of the sound quality, but went for the bose because of their comfort, their reputation and reviews. there was no way of knowing what they would sound like since they're kept under lock and key, so i made the purchase and opened them in the car to test them out. Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver

Item.Review: These head phone were given to me as a gift about 2 years ago. They sound amazing and fit quite well. That is till they start falling apart. First the left ear cup just detached from the rest of the head phones. I fixed that with some super glue. Now I find the the foam is starting to come out and the fabric on the ear cup is falling apart. Over all I do not recommend this product.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Comfort, Style
Cons: It comes with a soft bag that offers minimal protection.
I did extensive research trying to find a pair of headphones that would be perfect for me. After awhile of listening to a pair of cheap earbuds for a long time, I realized that my heavy music collection wasn't getting to its full potential. looked at many different brands and reviews and this is what I came up with.
At first I immediately though of the Beats. The were not for me however. The Beats are obviously bass driven, and the music I listen to ( rock, alternative, indie, acoustic) would sound a bit muddy. If you want style and tons of bass, go with the Beats.
The Sennheisers were popular brand by many people. My only problem is that their headphones are rather bulky. ...
Now to the Bose AE2. I put these on at Best Buy and immediately noticed how comfortable these felt. I read some reviews that said that they were not the best sounding, but gave them a try anyway. I have had these headphones for a week and am very impressed and pleased with my purchase. The are SUPER comfortable, and I cannot stress that enough. These are an extremely light pair of headphones with plush leather cushions on the ear pieces. The sound at first did sound a bit light. However all headphones need about 80-100 of break in time, so I waited. Its been about 10 hours with these of listening time and I can really hear the difference. The music is crisp. The bass is there, not overwhelming like the beats, but it is there and punchy. I am very happy with these so far. They are well worth the money and a no brainer investment if you care about your music collection like I do.
A few notes about sound quality. No headphones will sound good if the songs themselves are of low quality. Make sure your music has the highest bit rate as possible. Also change your EQ settings in iTunes. By default it is flat. Google "perfect EQ in Itunes" and there is a setting that I actually do think sounds WAY better. This combination of things can really get the most out of your music. I have made these changes, ... expand » « collapse

If you don't care about what format or what quality your songs are then DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. It is a great buy for the price but I'm sure there is something out there that can rival this. Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver

I work in a room (IT Developers) and we're a noisy bunch; every likes to have a conversation at the same time 5 feet away! It can easily rival a chicken coop. I put the headphones on and it's amazing difference in ambient noise. While I still hear 'some' of the conversations, they're not understandable, muffled is the correct word like when you stick your fingers in your ears, like that.
Now inside the headphones, they're comfortable to wear. I especially like the longer cord. The sound is crystal clear from the highs to the lows. I wish it had a little more base though. It's a good all around the ear for the money spent. If you're looking for one that's n ... ot cheap, not super expensive, but better than average, this is it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: sound quality
Cons: stifles ears after a long time of listening
I am a sophomore, basketball-playing college student, and because of the long team bus rides and constant travel during our season, I decided that I needed to get a decent pair of headphones. I am usually clumsy with expensive electronics, but my old iPod earbuds were not blocking out the sound of my teammates' music, which was driving me crazy. After doing a lot of research and debating between these and the Beats by Dre, I asked my parents for these headphones for Christmas. Unlike many of my college-basketball-playing counterparts, I am a more avid listener of classical and alternative music, rather than hip-hop. It was mostly this reason that I decided to overlook the mainstream Beats and go for the ... Bose. It was a GREAT decision. I didn't really believe that headphones could make you hear your music differently, but I seriously heard things in songs that I've never noticed before. It's like rediscovering all of my favorite music. I have one issue with comfort; when I have them on for more than an hour or so, I tend to take them off my ears and rest them on the side of my head for a few seconds, and let my ears 'air out.' And once I found the right size of the adjustable headband for my head, the way they sat on my head was not an issue. Overall, a great product and a great solution to my problem of other people's 'leaking' headphones expand » « collapse

When I tried these myself, I was amazed by how much they cut out ambient noise too. The ear pads are light as a feather and so soft. you hardly know you're wearing them.
The superb sound quality is exactly the same as the noise cancelling ones, so dont be put off by the price..

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Amazing sound, superb comfort, easily replaceable audio cable
Cons: Price can be high, they don't fold together
I got these for Christmas this year, and i was so happy because i wanted a pair of Bose headphones for a long time since i was introduced to them when i was a kid. These don't disappoint at all. These are also the first pair of headphones that i got that were over $100, which can be kind of pricey, but once you put these on, you can see why they are worth over $100 dollars. Being a musician and a lover of music, these will go a long way.
First off, the sound quality is...superb, to say the least. I've never heard anything so clear from a pair of headphones in my life, and they're not even noise cancelling! I did have a pair of $90 Sony noise cancelling ... headphones, and those were nice, but the Bose headphones are probably just as good as the Sonys when it comes to blocking out sound. The vocals are crystal clear, the bass is awesome, guitar is fantastic, and piano is lovely. I heard some parts in songs that i've never heard before with these headphones. They are perfectly balanced. Just make sure you have your MP3 player's EQ off. Bose headphones don't need any adjustment with sound.
Comfort is a big issue for me as well. If i can't wear a pair of headphones for a couple of hours without feeling any pressure, then they're not worth it. These feel like air on my ears. The tips of my ears brush against the inside of the phones, but that doesn't bother me, and i don't think that it affects sound quality. The top of my head is very grateful for the cushion on top. Overall, most comfortable headphones i've ever had so far.
I love that the audio cord is detachable. It makes it easier to replace, and you don't necessarily need to go to a Bose store to buy another cable. I'm not 100% sure though. I wish that they did fold up to make them smaller, but that's really my only complaint.
Overall, these headphones are a must buy if you want quality headphones, but don't want to spend a BOATLOAD of money (over 200 dollars) for a pair of headphones. I do want to eventually upgra ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review: I love the comfort and quality of these earphones.....of course, they are BOSE! You can't beat the sound when listening to music, sitting still. However, I purchased them to listen to music (MP3, IPOD, radio, etc.) when I go for my 3-5 mile walks and unfortunately, I found that my steps/body vibration (a thump echo noise) is picked up, distracting from the quality of the sound....a noise I never got from my inexpensive earplugs. This is disappointing from BOSE and for the price. I would certainly recommend them to anyone who loves to listen to quality sound, but not if they want to use while walking or running.

I tried in my laptop, but again I was disappointed. I have other Bose products and the sound quality is great on them, these headphones did not measure up to the Bose name. If you are ... using with an iPhone, get the Aviators. expand » « collapse

have had lot's of earbuds, now got the over the ear style . sound is so much better. still need my bose earbuds, but when i'm kicking back these are my choise every time, they feel great, light weight headphones with big crisp clean sound. i love them, well worth the money.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review: Double Check (For the money you pay)!! With all these in, all is well and good with your headphones, Agreed? Bass is only thing which is decent but not as high as beats , but I d rather prefer this to beats considering there are other song genres I like to listen to besides Hip Hop.

Item.Item: Bose AE2 audio headphones - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Silver
Item.Review: Great product. Way better than the Beats by Dre'. Very much enjoy these headphones. The Best Buy employees did a great job of selling me on all the good and bad points of each type of headphone.

Pros: Bose quality

My wife and I compared all of the head phones on display at the store. We both decided that the Bose sounded the best over all. The head phones are comfortable and are built pretty good. I like using them when I am on the treadmill.
